This class creates the main dialog.

Field Detail

AFFINE

public static final int AFFINE
Three points generate an affine transformation, which is any combination of translation, rotation, isotropic scaling, anisotropic scaling, shearing, and skewing. An affine transformation maps parallel lines onto parallel lines and is determined by 6 parameters.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

GENERIC_TRANSFORMATION

public static final int GENERIC_TRANSFORMATION
Generic geometric transformation.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

BILINEAR

public static final int BILINEAR
Four points describe a bilinear transformation, where a point of coordinates (x, y) is mapped on a point of coordinates (u, v) such that u = p0 + p1 x + p2 y + p3 x y and v = q0 + q1 x + q2 y + q3 x y. Thus, u and v are both linear in x, and in y as well. The bilinear transformation is determined by 8 parameters.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Blue slice.

public static final int MIN_SIZE
Minimal linear dimension of an image in the multiresolution pyramid.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RED

public static final int RED
Red slice.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

RIGID_BODY

public static final int RIGID_BODY
A single points determines the translation component of a rigid-body transformation. As the rotation is given by a scalar number, it is not natural to represent this number by coordinates of a point. The rigid-body transformation is determined by 3 parameters.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SCALED_ROTATION

public static final int SCALED_ROTATION
A pair of points determines the combination of a translation, of a rotation, and of an isotropic scaling. Angles are conserved. A scaled rotation is determined by 4 parameters.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

TRANSLATION

public static final int TRANSLATION
A translation is described by a single point. It keeps area, angle, and orientation. A translation is determined by 2 parameters.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

transformation

private static int transformation
Admissible values are {TRANSLATION, RIGID_BODY, SCALED_ROTATION, AFFINE, BILINEAR}.

Constructor Detail

turboRegDialog

public turboRegDialog(java.awt.Frame parentWindow,
                      ij.ImagePlus[] admissibleImageList)
This constructor prepares the dialog box and starts the first computational threads. The threads will need to be killed and restarted upon need. This constructor must be called when at least two images are available.

Parameters:
parentWindow - Parent window.
admissibleImageList - Array of ImagePlus images that are candidate to registration.
Method Detail

actionPerformed

public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
This method processes the button actions.

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
Parameters:
ae - The expected actions are as follows:
  • Load...: Load landmarks from a file;
  • Save Now...: Save landmarks into a file;
  • Cancel: Restore the progress bar and the toolbar, reset the ROI's, and then quit;
  • Manual: Create an output image that is distorted in such a way that the landmarks of the source are made to coincide with those of the target;
  • Automatic: Refine the landmarks of the source image in such a way that the least-squares error between the transformed source image and the target is minimized.

getInsets

public java.awt.Insets getInsets()
Return some additional margin to the dialog, for aesthetic purposes. Necessary for the current MacOS X Java version, lest the first item disappears from the frame.

Overrides:
getInsets in class java.awt.Container

joinThreads

public void joinThreads()
Wait until the threads that compute spline coefficients, image and mask pyramids are done.

restoreAll

public void restoreAll()
Restore the regular listener interfaces, restore the regular ImageJ toolbar, stop the progress bar, and ask for garbage collection.

See Also:

stopThreads

public void stopThreads()
Interrupt the two preprocessing threads.
